newsitem.title: BAHRAIN: PRESS DIGEST - Saudi newspapers - June 19.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Saudi newspapers - June 19.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Saudi Arabian press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Saudi's Al-Sultan Medical Co plans to set up a pharmaceutical plant for Mexican products in the kingdom.
- Saudi's National Company for Cooperative Insurance gears up for medical insurance market boom in the kingdom.
- Islamic Development Bank-sponsored seminar opened in Tunisia on Wednesday.
- Saudi king meets Palestinian President Arafat in Jeddah.
- Two criminals beheaded in Saudi for armed robbery.
- Saudi licenses the setting up of al-Qassim Tourism Services with a paid-in capital of 20 million riyals.
- Founder shareholders of the Saudi White Cement Company meet in Riyadh to discuss subscription in the newly-set up firm.
